platform.title: Platform

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for profiling during ingestion. Allowed by the `table_pattern`.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

database_alias.title: Database Alias
database_alias.description: Alias to apply to database when ingesting.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Whether table lineage should be ingested.

use_s3_object_tags.description: If an S3 Objects Tags should be created for the Tables ingested by Glue.

base_path.title: Base Path
base_path.description: Path to table (s3 or local file system). If path is not a delta table path then all subfolders will be scanned to detect and ingest delta tables.

relative_path.title: Relative Path
relative_path.description: If set, delta-tables will be searched at location '<base_path>/<relative_path>' and URNs will be created using relative_path only.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion.

version_history_lookback.title: Version History Lookback
version_history_lookback.description: Number of previous version histories to be ingested. Defaults to 1. If set to -1 all version history will be ingested.

require_files.title: Require Files
require_files.description: Whether DeltaTable should track files. Consider setting this to `False` for large delta tables, resulting in significant memory reduction for ingestion process.When set to `False`, number_of_files in delta table can not be reported.

dbt_config.title: DBTCoreConfig
dbt_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

sql_parser_use_external_process.title: Sql Parser Use External Process
sql_parser_use_external_process.description: When enabled, sql parser will run in isolated in a separate process. This can affect processing time but can protect from sql parser's mem leak.

env.description: Environment to use in namespace when constructing URNs.

platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

target_platform.description: The platform that dbt is loading onto. (e.g. bigquery / redshift / postgres etc.)

target_platform_instance.title: Target Platform Instance
target_platform_instance.description: The platform instance for the platform that dbt is operating on. Use this if you have multiple instances of the same platform (e.g. redshift) and need to distinguish between them.

use_identifiers.title: Use Identifiers
use_identifiers.description: Use model identifier instead of model name if defined (if not, default to model name).

entities_enabled.title: Entities Enabled
entities_enabled.description: Controls for enabling / disabling metadata emission for different dbt entities (models, test definitions, test results, etc.)

tag_prefix.title: Tag Prefix
tag_prefix.description: Prefix added to tags during ingestion.

node_name_pattern.title: Node Name Pattern
node_name_pattern.description: regex patterns for dbt model names to filter in ingestion.

meta_mapping.title: Meta Mapping
meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

column_meta_mapping.title: Column Meta Mapping
column_meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt column meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

query_tag_mapping.title: Query Tag Mapping
query_tag_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt query_tag meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

write_semantics.title: Write Semantics
write_semantics.description: Whether the new tags, terms and owners to be added will override the existing ones added only by this source or not. Value for this config can be "PATCH" or "OVERRIDE"

strip_user_ids_from_email.title: Strip User Ids From Email
strip_user_ids_from_email.description: Whether or not to strip email id while adding owners using dbt meta actions.

enable_owner_extraction.title: Enable Owner Extraction
enable_owner_extraction.description: When enabled, ownership info will be extracted from the dbt meta

owner_extraction_pattern.title: Owner Extraction Pattern
owner_extraction_pattern.description: Regex string to extract owner from the dbt node using the `(?P<name>...) syntax` of the [match object](https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#match-objects), where the group name must be `owner`. Examples: (1)`r"(?P<owner>(.*)): (\w+) (\w+)"` will extract `jdoe` as the owner from `"jdoe: John Doe"` (2) `r"@(?P<owner>(.*))"` will extract `alice` as the owner from `"@alice"`.

backcompat_skip_source_on_lineage_edge.title: Backcompat Skip Source On Lineage Edge
backcompat_skip_source_on_lineage_edge.description: Prior to version 0.8.41, lineage edges to sources were directed to the target platform node rather than the dbt source node. This contradicted the established pattern for other lineage edges to point to upstream dbt nodes. To revert lineage logic to this legacy approach, set this flag to true.

enable_meta_mapping.title: Enable Meta Mapping
enable_meta_mapping.description: When enabled, applies the mappings that are defined through the meta_mapping directives.

enable_query_tag_mapping.title: Enable Query Tag Mapping
enable_query_tag_mapping.description: When enabled, applies the mappings that are defined through the `query_tag_mapping` directives.

manifest_path.title: Manifest Path
manifest_path.description: Path to dbt manifest JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/manifest-json Note this can be a local file or a URI.

catalog_path.title: Catalog Path
catalog_path.description: Path to dbt catalog JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/catalog-json Note this can be a local file or a URI.

sources_path.title: Sources Path
sources_path.description: Path to dbt sources JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/sources-json. If not specified, last-modified fields will not be populated. Note this can be a local file or a URI.

test_results_path.title: Test Results Path
test_results_path.description: Path to output of dbt test run as run_results file in JSON format. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/run-results-json. If not specified, test execution results will not be populated in DataHub.

Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

database_alias.title: Database Alias
database_alias.description: Alias to apply to database when ingesting.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

default_schema.title: Default Schema
default_schema.description: The default schema to use if the sql parser fails to parse the schema with `sql_based` lineage collector

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Whether table lineage should be ingested.

include_copy_lineage.title: Include Copy Lineage
include_copy_lineage.description: Whether lineage should be collected from copy commands

capture_lineage_query_parser_failures.title: Capture Lineage Query Parser Failures
capture_lineage_query_parser_failures.description: Whether to capture lineage query parser errors with dataset properties for debuggings

table_lineage_mode.description: Which table lineage collector mode to use. Available modes are: [stl_scan_based, sql_based, mixed]

explore_naming_pattern.description: Pattern for providing dataset names to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

explore_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

view_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to views. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

tag_measures_and_dimensions.title: Tag Measures And Dimensions
tag_measures_and_dimensions.description: When enabled, attaches tags to measures, dimensions and dimension groups to make them more discoverable. When disabled, adds this information to the description of the column.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Views and Explores

base_folder.title: Base Folder
base_folder.description: Required if not providing github configuration and deploy keys. A pointer to a local directory (accessible to the ingestion system) where the root of the LookML repo has been checked out (typically via a git clone). This is typically the root folder where the `*.model.lkml` and `*.view.lkml` files are stored. e.g. If you have checked out your LookML repo under `/Users/jdoe/workspace/my-lookml-repo`, then set `base_folder` to `/Users/jdoe/workspace/my-lookml-repo`.

github_info.title: Github Info
github_info.description: Reference to your github location. If present, supplies handy links to your lookml on the dataset entity page.

project_dependencies.title: Project Dependencies
project_dependencies.description: A map of project_name to local directory (accessible to the ingestion system) or Git credentials. Every local_dependencies or private remote_dependency listed in the main project's manifest.lkml file should have a corresponding entry here. If a deploy key is not provided, the ingestion system will use the same deploy key as the main project.

connection_to_platform_map.title: Connection To Platform Map
connection_to_platform_map.description: A mapping of [Looker connection names](https://docs.looker.com/reference/model-params/connection-for-model) to DataHub platform, database, and schema values.

model_pattern.title: Model Pattern
model_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for LookML models to include in the extraction.

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for LookML views to include in the extraction.

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: Required if you don't specify the `api` section. The project name within which all the model files live. See (https://docs.looker.com/data-modeling/getting-started/how-project-works) to understand what the Looker project name should be. The simplest way to see your projects is to click on `Develop` followed by `Manage LookML Projects` in the Looker application.

transport_options.title: Transport Options
transport_options.description: Populates the [TransportOptions](https://github.com/looker-open-source/sdk-codegen/blob/94d6047a0d52912ac082eb91616c1e7c379ab262/python/looker_sdk/rtl/transport.py#L70) struct for looker client

max_file_snippet_length.title: Max File Snippet Length
max_file_snippet_length.description: When extracting the view definition from a lookml file, the maximum number of characters to extract.

emit_reachable_views_only.title: Emit Reachable Views Only
emit_reachable_views_only.description: When enabled, only views that are reachable from explores defined in the model files are emitted

populate_sql_logic_for_missing_descripti.title: Populate Sql Logic For Missing Descriptions
populate_sql_logic_for_missing_descripti.description: When enabled, field descriptions will include the sql logic for computed fields if descriptions are missing

process_isolation_for_sql_parsing.title: Process Isolation For Sql Parsing
process_isolation_for_sql_parsing.description: When enabled, sql parsing will be executed in a separate process to prevent memory leaks.

max_path_depth.description: Maximum folder depth to crawl for Iceberg tables.  Folders deeper than this value will be silently ignored.

user_ownership_property.description: Iceberg table property to look for a `CorpUser` owner.  Can only hold a single user value.  If property has no value, no owner information will be emitted.

group_ownership_property.title: Group Ownership Property
group_ownership_property.description: Iceberg table property to look for a `CorpGroup` owner.  Can only hold a single group value.  If property has no value, no owner information will be emitted.

extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Views and Explores

base_url.title: Base Url
base_url.description: Url to your Looker instance: `https://company.looker.com:19999` or `https://looker.company.com`, or similar. Used for making API calls to Looker and constructing clickable dashboard and chart urls.

transport_options.title: Transport Options
transport_options.description: Populates the [TransportOptions](https://github.com/looker-open-source/sdk-codegen/blob/94d6047a0d52912ac082eb91616c1e7c379ab262/python/looker_sdk/rtl/transport.py#L70) struct for looker client

dashboard_pattern.title: Dashboard Pattern
dashboard_pattern.description: Patterns for selecting dashboard ids that are to be included

chart_pattern.title: Chart Pattern
chart_pattern.description: Patterns for selecting chart ids that are to be included

extract_owners.title: Extract Owners
extract_owners.description: When enabled, extracts ownership from Looker directly. When disabled, ownership is left empty for dashboards and charts.

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: This config is deprecated in favor of `extract_owners`. Previously, was the actor to use in ownership properties of ingested metadata.

strip_user_ids_from_email.title: Strip User Ids From Email
strip_user_ids_from_email.description: When enabled, converts Looker user emails of the form name@domain.com to urn:li:corpuser:name when assigning ownership

skip_personal_folders.title: Skip Personal Folders
skip_personal_folders.description: Whether to skip ingestion of dashboards in personal folders. Setting this to True will only ingest dashboards in the Shared folder space.

max_threads.title: Max Threads
max_threads.description: Max parallelism for Looker API calls. Defaults to cpuCount or 40

external_base_url.title: External Base Url
external_base_url.description: Optional URL to use when constructing external URLs to Looker if the `base_url` is not the correct one to use. For example, `https://looker-public.company.com`. If not provided, the external base URL will default to `base_url`.

extract_usage_history.title: Extract Usage History
extract_usage_history.description: Whether to ingest usage statistics for dashboards. Setting this to True will query looker system activity explores to fetch historical dashboard usage.

extract_usage_history_for_interval.title: Extract Usage History For Interval
extract_usage_history_for_interval.description: Used only if extract_usage_history is set to True. Interval to extract looker dashboard usage history for. See https://docs.looker.com/reference/filter-expressions#date_and_time.

file.title: File
file.description: Path to lineage file to ingest.

preserve_upstream.title: Preserve Upstream
preserve_upstream.description: Whether we want to query datahub-gms for upstream data. False means it will hard replace upstream data for a given entity. True means it will query the backend for existing upstreams and include it in the ingestion run

If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

sql_parser_use_external_process.description: When enabled, sql parser will run in isolated in a separate process. This can affect processing time but can protect from sql parser's mem leak.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`)

rate_limit.title: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: Should we rate limit requests made to API.

requests_per_min.title: Requests Per Min
requests_per_min.description: Used to control number of API calls made per min. Only used when `rate_limit` is set to `True`.

temp_table_dataset_prefix.title: Temp Table Dataset Prefix
temp_table_dataset_prefix.description: If you are creating temp tables in a dataset with a particular prefix you can use this config to set the prefix for the dataset. This is to support workflows from before bigquery's introduction of temp tables. By default we use `_` because of datasets that begin with an underscore are hidden by default https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/datasets#dataset-naming.

sharded_table_pattern.title: Sharded Table Pattern
sharded_table_pattern.description: The regex pattern to match sharded tables and group as one table. This is a very low level config parameter, only change if you know what you are doing,

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: [deprecated] Use project_id_pattern instead. You can use this property if you only want to ingest one project and don't want to give project resourcemanager.projects.list to your service account

log_page_size.title: Log Page Size
log_page_size.description: The number of log item will be queried per page for lineage collection

extra_client_options.title: Extra Client Options
extra_client_options.description: Additional options to pass to google.cloud.logging_v2.client.Client.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Option to enable/disable lineage generation. Is enabled by default.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.title: Bigquery Audit Metadata Datasets
bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.description: A list of datasets that contain a table named cloudaudit_googleapis_com_data_access which contain BigQuery audit logs, specifically, those containing BigQueryAuditMetadata. It is recommended that the project of the dataset is also specified, for example, projectA.datasetB.

use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.title: Use Exported Bigquery Audit Metadata
use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.description: When configured, use BigQueryAuditMetadata in bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets to compute lineage information.

use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.title: Use Date Sharded Audit Log Tables
use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.description: Whether to read date sharded tables or time partitioned tables when extracting usage from exported audit logs.

use_v2_audit_metadata.title: Use V2 Audit Metadata
use_v2_audit_metadata.description: Whether to ingest logs using the v2 format.

upstream_lineage_in_report.title: Upstream Lineage In Report
upstream_lineage_in_report.description: Useful for debugging lineage information. Set to True to see the raw lineage created internally.

project_id_pattern.title: Project Id Pattern
project_id_pattern.description: Regex patterns for project_id to filter in ingestion.

capture_table_label_as_tag.title: Capture Table Label As Tag
capture_table_label_as_tag.description: Capture BigQuery table labels as tag

dataset_pattern.title: Dataset Pattern
dataset_pattern.description: Regex patterns for dataset to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

match_fully_qualified_names.title: Match Fully Qualified Names
match_fully_qualified_names.description: Whether `dataset_pattern` is matched against fully qualified dataset name `<project_id>.<dataset_name>`.

include_external_url.title: Include External Url
include_external_url.description: Whether to populate BigQuery Console url to Datasets/Tables

debug_include_full_payloads.title: Debug Include Full Payloads
debug_include_full_payloads.description: Include full payload into events. It is only for debugging and internal use.

number_of_datasets_process_in_batch.title: Number Of Datasets Process In Batch
number_of_datasets_process_in_batch.description: Number of table queried in batch when getting metadata. This is a low level config property which should be touched with care. This restriction is needed because we query partitions system view which throws error if we try to touch too many tables.

column_limit.title: Column Limit
column_limit.description: Maximum number of columns to process in a table. This is a low level config property which should be touched with care. This restriction is needed because excessively wide tables can result in failure to ingest the schema.

project_on_behalf.title: Project On Behalf
project_on_behalf.description: [Advanced] The BigQuery project in which queries are executed. Will be passed when creating a job. If not passed, falls back to the project associated with the service account..

lineage_use_sql_parser.title: Lineage Use Sql Parser
lineage_use_sql_parser.description: Experimental. Use sql parser to resolve view/table lineage. If there is a view being referenced then bigquery sends both the view as well as underlying tablein the references. There is no distinction between direct/base objects accessed. So doing sql parsing to ensure we only use direct objects accessed for lineage.

lineage_parse_view_ddl.title: Lineage Parse View Ddl
lineage_parse_view_ddl.description: Sql parse view ddl to get lineage.

rate_limit.description: Should we rate limit requests made to API.

requests_per_min.title: Requests Per Min
requests_per_min.description: Used to control number of API calls made per min. Only used when `rate_limit` is set to `True`.

temp_table_dataset_prefix.title: Temp Table Dataset Prefix
temp_table_dataset_prefix.description: If you are creating temp tables in a dataset with a particular prefix you can use this config to set the prefix for the dataset. This is to support workflows from before bigquery's introduction of temp tables. By default we use `_` because of datasets that begin with an underscore are hidden by default https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/datasets#dataset-naming.

sharded_table_pattern.title: Sharded Table Pattern
sharded_table_pattern.description: The regex pattern to match sharded tables and group as one table. This is a very low level config parameter, only change if you know what you are doing,

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: List of project ids to ingest usage from. If not specified, will infer from environment.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: Project ID to ingest usage from. If not specified, will infer from environment. Deprecated in favour of projects

extra_client_options.title: Extra Client Options
extra_client_options.description: Additional options to pass to google.cloud.logging_v2.client.Client.

use_v2_audit_metadata.title: Use V2 Audit Metadata
use_v2_audit_metadata.description: Whether to ingest logs using the v2 format. Required if use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata is set to True.

bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.title: Bigquery Audit Metadata Datasets
bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.description: A list of datasets that contain a table named cloudaudit_googleapis_com_data_access which contain BigQuery audit logs, specifically, those containing BigQueryAuditMetadata. It is recommended that the project of the dataset is also specified, for example, projectA.datasetB.

use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.title: Use Exported Bigquery Audit Metadata
use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.description: When configured, use BigQueryAuditMetadata in bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets to compute usage information.

use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.title: Use Date Sharded Audit Log Tables
use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.description: Whether to read date sharded tables or time partitioned tables when extracting usage from exported audit logs.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for tables to include/exclude from ingestion.

dataset_pattern.title: Dataset Pattern
dataset_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for datasets to include/exclude from ingestion.

query_log_delay.title: Query Log Delay
query_log_delay.description: To account for the possibility that the query event arrives after the read event in the audit logs, we wait for at least query_log_delay additional events to be processed before attempting to resolve BigQuery job information from the logs. If query_log_delay is None, it gets treated as an unlimited delay, which prioritizes correctness at the expense of memory usage.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

credential.title: Credential
credential.description: Bigquery credential. Required if GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable is not set. See this example recipe for details

pulsar_config.title: PulsarSourceConfig
pulsar_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

web_service_url.title: Web Service Url
web_service_url.description: The web URL for the cluster.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timout setting, how long to wait for the Pulsar rest api to send data before giving up

issuer_url.title: Issuer Url
issuer_url.description: The complete URL for a Custom Authorization Server. Mandatory for OAuth based authentication.

token.title: Token
token.description: The access token for the application. Mandatory for token based authentication.

verify_ssl.title: Verify Ssl
verify_ssl.description: Either a boolean, in which case it controls whether we verify the server's TLS certificate, or a string, in which case it must be a path to a CA bundle to use.

tenant_patterns.title: Tenant Patterns
tenant_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for tenants to include/exclude from ingestion. By default all tenants are allowed.

namespace_patterns.title: Namespace Patterns
namespace_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for namespaces to include/exclude from ingestion. By default the functions namespace is denied.

topic_patterns.title: Topic Patterns
topic_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for topics to include/exclude from ingestion. By default the Pulsar system topics are denied.

exclude_individual_partitions.title: Exclude Individual Partitions
exclude_individual_partitions.description: Extract each individual partitioned topic. e.g. when turned off a topic with 100 partitions will result in 100 Datasets.

tenants.title: Tenants
tenants.description: Listing all tenants requires superUser role, alternative you can set a list of tenants you want to scrape using the tenant admin role

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Domain patterns

kafka_config.title: KafkaSourceConfig
kafka_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The platform that this source connects to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: A map of domain names to allow deny patterns. Domains can be urn-based (`urn:li:domain:13ae4d85-d955-49fc-8474-9004c663a810`) or bare (`13ae4d85-d955-49fc-8474-9004c663a810`).

topic_subject_map.title: Topic Subject Map
topic_subject_map.description: Provides the mapping for the `key` and the `value` schemas of a topic to the corresponding schema registry subject name. Each entry of this map has the form `<topic_name>-key`:`<schema_registry_subject_name_for_key_schema>` and `<topic_name>-value`:`<schema_registry_subject_name_for_value_schema>` for the key and the value schemas associated with the topic, respectively. This parameter is mandatory when the [RecordNameStrategy](https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/schema-registry/serdes-develop/index.html#how-the-naming-strategies-work) is used as the subject naming strategy in the kafka schema registry. NOTE: When provided, this overrides the default subject name resolution even when the `TopicNameStrategy` or the `TopicRecordNameStrategy` are used.

schema_registry_class.title: Schema Registry Class
schema_registry_class.description: The fully qualified implementation class(custom) that implements the KafkaSchemaRegistryBase interface.

ignore_warnings_on_schema_type.title: Ignore Warnings On Schema Type
ignore_warnings_on_schema_type.description: Disables warnings reported for non-AVRO/Protobuf value or key schemas if set.

dashboard_patterns.title: Dashboard Patterns
dashboard_patterns.description: regex patterns for dashboards to filter for ingestion.

chart_patterns.title: Chart Patterns
chart_patterns.description: regex patterns for charts to filter for ingestion.

skip_draft.title: Skip Draft
skip_draft.description: Only ingest published dashboards and charts.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Limit on number of items to be queried at once.

api_page_limit.title: Api Page Limit
api_page_limit.description: Limit on number of pages queried for ingesting dashboards and charts API during pagination.

sql_parser.title: Sql Parser
sql_parser.description: custom SQL parser. See note below for details.

env.title: Env
env.description: Environment to use in namespace when constructing URNs.

okta_domain.title: Okta Domain
okta_domain.description: The location of your Okta Domain, without a protocol. Can be found in Okta Developer console. e.g. dev-33231928.okta.com

okta_api_token.title: Okta Api Token
okta_api_token.description: An API token generated for the DataHub application inside your Okta Developer Console. e.g. 00be4R_M2MzDqXawbWgfKGpKee0kuEOfX1RCQSRx00

ingest_users.title: Ingest Users
ingest_users.description: Whether users should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_groups.title: Ingest Groups
ingest_groups.description: Whether groups should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_group_membership.title: Ingest Group Membership
ingest_group_membership.description: Whether group membership should be ingested into DataHub. ingest_groups must be True if this is True.

okta_profile_to_username_attr.title: Okta Profile To Username Attr
okta_profile_to_username_attr.description: Which Okta User Profile attribute to use as input to DataHub username mapping.

okta_profile_to_username_regex.title: Okta Profile To Username Regex
okta_profile_to_username_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub username from the attribute specified in `okta_profile_to_username_attr`.

okta_profile_to_group_name_attr.title: Okta Profile To Group Name Attr
okta_profile_to_group_name_attr.description: Which Okta Group Profile attribute to use as input to DataHub group name mapping.

okta_profile_to_group_name_regex.title: Okta Profile To Group Name Regex
okta_profile_to_group_name_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub group name from the attribute specified in `okta_profile_to_group_name_attr`.

include_deprovisioned_users.title: Include Deprovisioned Users
include_deprovisioned_users.description: Whether to ingest users in the DEPROVISIONED state from Okta.

include_suspended_users.title: Include Suspended Users
include_suspended_users.description: Whether to ingest users in the SUSPENDED state from Okta.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: The number of entities requested from Okta's REST APIs in one request.

delay_seconds.title: Delay Seconds
delay_seconds.description: Number of seconds to wait between calls to Okta's REST APIs. (Okta rate limits). Defaults to 10ms.

okta_users_filter.title: Okta Users Filter
okta_users_filter.description: Okta filter expression (not regex) for ingesting users. Only one of `okta_users_filter` and `okta_users_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#list-users-with-a-filter) for more info.

okta_users_search.title: Okta Users Search
okta_users_search.description: Okta search expression (not regex) for ingesting users. Only one of `okta_users_filter` and `okta_users_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#list-users-with-search) for more info.

okta_groups_filter.title: Okta Groups Filter
okta_groups_filter.description: Okta filter expression (not regex) for ingesting groups. Only one of `okta_groups_filter` and `okta_groups_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/groups/#filters) for more info.

okta_groups_search.title: Okta Groups Search
okta_groups_search.description: Okta search expression (not regex) for ingesting groups. Only one of `okta_groups_filter` and `okta_groups_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/groups/#list-groups-with-search) for more info.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for profiling during ingestion. Allowed by the `table_pattern`.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

database_alias.title: Database Alias

sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

views_where_clause_suffix.title: Views Where Clause Suffix
views_where_clause_suffix.description: Where clause to specify what Presto views should be ingested.

tables_where_clause_suffix.title: Tables Where Clause Suffix
tables_where_clause_suffix.description: Where clause to specify what Hive tables should be ingested.

schemas_where_clause_suffix.title: Schemas Where Clause Suffix

metastore_db_name.title: Metastore Db Name
metastore_db_name.description: Name of the Hive metastore's database (usually: metastore). For backward compatibility, if this field is not provided, the database field will be used. If both the 'database' and 'metastore_db_name' fields are set then the 'database' field will be used to filter the hive/presto/trino database

mode.description: The ingested data will be stored under this platform. Valid options: ['hive', 'presto', 'presto-on-hive', 'trino']

use_catalog_subtype.title: Use Catalog Subtype
use_catalog_subtype.description: Container Subtype name to be 'Database' or 'Catalog' Valid options: ['True', 'False']

use_dataset_pascalcase_subtype.title: Use Dataset Pascalcase Subtype
use_dataset_pascalcase_subtype.description: Dataset Subtype name to be 'Table' or 'View' Valid options: ['True', 'False']

include_catalog_name_in_ids.title: Include Catalog Name In Ids
include_catalog_name_in_ids.description: Add the Presto catalog name (e.g. hive) to the generated dataset urns. `urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:hive,hive.user.logging_events,PROD)` versus `urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:hive,user.logging_events,PROD)`

client_secret.description: Client secret. Found in your app registration on Azure AD Portal

authority.title: Authority
authority.description: The authority (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/msal-client-application-configuration) is a URL that indicates a directory that MSAL can request tokens from.

token_url.title: Token Url
token_url.description: The token URL that acquires a token from Azure AD for authorizing requests.  This source will only work with v1.0 endpoint.

redirect.title: Redirect
redirect.description: Redirect URI.  Found in your app registration on Azure AD Portal.

azure_ad_response_to_username_attr.title: Azure Ad Response To Username Attr
azure_ad_response_to_username_attr.description: Which Azure AD User Response attribute to use as input to DataHub username mapping.

azure_ad_response_to_username_regex.title: Azure Ad Response To Username Regex
azure_ad_response_to_username_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub username from the attribute specified in `azure_ad_response_to_username_attr`.

azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr.title: Azure Ad Response To Groupname Attr
azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr.description: Which Azure AD Group Response attribute to use as input to DataHub group name mapping.

azure_ad_response_to_groupname_regex.title: Azure Ad Response To Groupname Regex
azure_ad_response_to_groupname_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub group name from the attribute specified in `azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr`.

ingest_users.title: Ingest Users
ingest_users.description: Whether users should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_groups.title: Ingest Groups
ingest_groups.description: Whether groups should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_group_membership.title: Ingest Group Membership
ingest_group_membership.description: Whether group membership should be ingested into DataHub. ingest_groups must be True if this is True.

ingest_groups_users.title: Ingest Groups Users
ingest_groups_users.description: This option is useful only when `ingest_users` is set to False and `ingest_group_membership` to True. As effect, only the users which belongs to the selected groups will be ingested.

users_pattern.title: Users Pattern
users_pattern.description: regex patterns for users to filter in ingestion.

groups_pattern.title: Groups Pattern
groups_pattern.description: regex patterns for groups to include in ingestion.

filtered_tracking.title: Filtered Tracking
filtered_tracking.description: If enabled, report will contain names of filtered users and groups.

mask_group_id.title: Mask Group Id
mask_group_id.description: Whether workunit ID's for groups should be masked to avoid leaking sensitive information.

mask_user_id.title: Mask User Id
mask_user_id.description: Whether workunit ID's for users should be masked to avoid leaking sensitive information.

platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for profiling during ingestion. Allowed by the `table_pattern`.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

database_alias.title: Database Alias
database_alias.description: Alias to apply to database when ingesting.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

mode_config.description:

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`)

rate_limit.title: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: Should we rate limit requests made to API.

requests_per_min.title: Requests Per Min
requests_per_min.description: Used to control number of API calls made per min. Only used when `rate_limit` is set to `True`.

temp_table_dataset_prefix.title: Temp Table Dataset Prefix
temp_table_dataset_prefix.description: If you are creating temp tables in a dataset with a particular prefix you can use this config to set the prefix for the dataset. This is to support workflows from before bigquery's introduction of temp tables. By default we use `_` because of datasets that begin with an underscore are hidden by default https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/datasets#dataset-naming.

sharded_table_pattern.title: Sharded Table Pattern
sharded_table_pattern.description: The regex pattern to match sharded tables and group as one table. This is a very low level config parameter, only change if you know what you are doing,

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: Project ID where you have rights to run queries and create tables. If `storage_project_id` is not specified then it is assumed this is the same project where data is stored. If not specified, will infer from environment.

storage_project_id.title: Storage Project Id
storage_project_id.description: If your data is stored in a different project where you don't have rights to run jobs and create tables then specify this field. The same service account must have read rights in this GCP project and write rights in `project_id`.

log_page_size.title: Log Page Size
log_page_size.description: The number of log item will be queried per page for lineage collection

extra_client_options.title: Extra Client Options
extra_client_options.description: Additional options to pass to google.cloud.logging_v2.client.Client.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Option to enable/disable lineage generation. Is enabled by default.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.title: Bigquery Audit Metadata Datasets
bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.description: A list of datasets that contain a table named cloudaudit_googleapis_com_data_access which contain BigQuery audit logs, specifically, those containing BigQueryAuditMetadata. It is recommended that the project of the dataset is also specified, for example, projectA.datasetB.

use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.title: Use Exported Bigquery Audit Metadata
use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.description: When configured, use BigQueryAuditMetadata in bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets to compute lineage information.

use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.title: Use Date Sharded Audit Log Tables
use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.description: Whether to read date sharded tables or time partitioned tables when extracting usage from exported audit logs.

use_v2_audit_metadata.title: Use V2 Audit Metadata
use_v2_audit_metadata.description: Whether to ingest logs using the v2 format.

upstream_lineage_in_report.title: Upstream Lineage In Report
upstream_lineage_in_report.description: Useful for debugging lineage information. Set to True to see the raw lineage created internally.

clickhouse_config.title: ClickHouseConfig
clickhouse_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

username.title: Username
username.description: Tableau username, must be set if authenticating using username/password.

password.title: Password
password.description: Tableau password, must be set if authenticating using username/password.

token_name.title: Token Name
token_name.description: Tableau token name, must be set if authenticating using a personal access token.

token_value.title: Token Value
token_value.description: Tableau token value, must be set if authenticating using a personal access token.

site.title: Site
site.description: Tableau Site. Always required for Tableau Online. Use emptystring to connect with Default site on Tableau Server.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

ssl_verify.title: Ssl Verify
ssl_verify.description: Whether to verify SSL certificates. If using self-signed certificates, set to false or provide the path to the .pem certificate bundle.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Tableau Datasources

ingest_owner.title: Ingest Owner
ingest_owner.description: Ingest Owner from source. This will override Owner info entered from UI

ingest_tables_external.title: Ingest Tables External
ingest_tables_external.description: Ingest details for tables external to (not embedded in) tableau as entities.

page_size.description: Number of metadata objects (e.g. CustomSQLTable, PublishedDatasource, etc) to query at a time using Tableau api.

lineage_overrides.title: Lineage Overrides
lineage_overrides.description: Mappings to change generated dataset urns. Use only if you really know what you are doing.

extract_usage_stats.title: Extract Usage Stats
extract_usage_stats.description: [experimental] Extract usage statistics for dashboards and charts.

env.title: Env

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

private_key.title: Private Key
private_key.description:
Private key in a form of '-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
private-key
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
' if using key pair authentication. Encrypted version of private key will be in a form of '-----BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
encrypted-private-key
-----END ECNCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
' See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_path.title: Private Key Path
private_key_path.description: The path to the private key if using key pair authentication. Ignored if `private_key` is set. See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_password.title: Private Key Password
private_key_password.description: Password for your private key. Required if using key pair authentication with encrypted private key.

authentication_type.title: Authentication Type
authentication_type.description: The type of authenticator to use when connecting to Snowflake. Supports "DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATOR", "EXTERNAL_BROWSER_AUTHENTICATOR" and "KEY_PAIR_AUTHENTICATOR".

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: Snowflake account identifier. e.g. xy12345,  xy12345.us-east-2.aws, xy12345.us-central1.gcp, xy12345.central-us.azure, xy12345.us-west-2.privatelink. Refer [Account Identifiers](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/admin-account-identifier.html#format-2-legacy-account-locator-in-a-region) for more details.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake table-to-table and s3-to-snowflake table lineage. Requires appropriate grants given to the role.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake view->table and table->view lineages (no view->view lineage yet). Requires appropriate grants given to the role, and include_table_lineage to be True.

connect_args.title: Connect Args
connect_args.description: Connect args to pass to Snowflake SqlAlchemy driver

email_domain.title: Email Domain
email_domain.description: Email domain of your organisation so users can be displayed on UI appropriately.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern

domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

deny.title: Deny
deny.description: List of regex patterns to exclude from ingestion.

ignoreCase.title: Ignorecase
ignoreCase.description: Whether to ignore case sensitivity during pattern matching.

type.description: The type of the state provider to use. For DataHub use `datahub`

config.description: The configuration required for initializing the state provider. Default: The datahub_api config if set at pipeline level. Otherwise, the default DatahubClientConfig. See the defaults (https://github.com/datahub-project/datahub/blob/master/metadata-ingestion/src/datahub/ingestion/graph/client.py#L19).

StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig.title: StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig
StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig.description: Base specialized config for Stateful Ingestion with stale metadata removal capability.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: The type of the ingestion state provider registered with datahub.

ignore_old_state.title: Ignore Old State
ignore_old_state.description: If set to True, ignores the previous checkpoint state.

ignore_new_state.title: Ignore New State
ignore_new_state.description: If set to True, ignores the current checkpoint state.

remove_stale_metadata.title: Remove Stale Metadata
remove_stale_metadata.description: Soft-deletes the entities present in the last successful run but missing in the current run with stateful_ingestion enabled.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Max number of documents to profile. By default, profiles all documents.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset in documents to profile. By default, uses no offset.

report_dropped_profiles.title: Report Dropped Profiles
report_dropped_profiles.description: Whether to report datasets or dataset columns which were not profiled. Set to `True` for debugging purposes.

turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.title: Turn Off Expensive Profiling Metrics
turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.description: Whether to turn off expensive profiling or not. This turns off profiling for quantiles, distinct_value_frequencies, histogram & sample_values. This also limits maximum number of fields being profiled to 10.

profile_table_level_only.title: Profile Table Level Only
profile_table_level_only.description: Whether to perform profiling at table-level only, or include column-level profiling as well.

include_field_null_count.title: Include Field Null Count
include_field_null_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of nulls for each column.

include_field_distinct_count.title: Include Field Distinct Count
include_field_distinct_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of distinct values for each column.

include_field_min_value.title: Include Field Min Value
include_field_min_value.description: Whether to profile for the min value of numeric columns.

include_field_max_value.title: Include Field Max Value
include_field_max_value.description: Whether to profile for the max value of numeric columns.

include_field_mean_value.title: Include Field Mean Value
include_field_mean_value.description: Whether to profile for the mean value of numeric columns.

include_field_median_value.title: Include Field Median Value
include_field_median_value.description: Whether to profile for the median value of numeric columns.

include_field_stddev_value.title: Include Field Stddev Value
include_field_stddev_value.description: Whether to profile for the standard deviation of numeric columns.

include_field_quantiles.title: Include Field Quantiles
include_field_quantiles.description: Whether to profile for the quantiles of numeric columns.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.title: Include Field Distinct Value Frequencies
include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

include_field_histogram.title: Include Field Histogram
include_field_histogram.description: Whether to profile for the histogram for numeric fields.

include_field_sample_values.title: Include Field Sample Values
include_field_sample_values.description: Whether to profile for the sample values for all columns.

max_number_of_fields_to_profile.title: Max Number Of Fields To Profile
max_number_of_fields_to_profile.description: A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of columns to profile for any table. `None` implies all columns. The cost of profiling goes up significantly as the number of columns to profile goes up.

profile_if_updated_since_days.title: Profile If Updated Since Days
profile_if_updated_since_days.description: Profile table only if it has been updated since these many number of days. If set to `null`, no constraint of last modified time for tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`.

profile_table_size_limit.title: Profile Table Size Limit
profile_table_size_limit.description: Profile tables only if their size is less then specified GBs. If set to `null`, no limit on the size of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_limit.title: Profile Table Row Limit
profile_table_row_limit.description: Profile tables only if their row count is less then specified count. If set to `null`, no limit on the row count of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Number of worker threads to use for profiling. Set to 1 to disable.

query_combiner_enabled.title: Query Combiner Enabled
query_combiner_enabled.description: *This feature is still experimental and can be disabled if it causes issues.* Reduces the total number of queries issued and speeds up profiling by dynamically combining SQL queries where possible.

partition_datetime.title: Partition Datetime
partition_datetime.description: For partitioned datasets profile only the partition which matches the datetime or profile the latest one if not set. Only Bigquery supports this.

RoleArn.title: Rolearn
RoleArn.description: ARN of the role to assume.

ExternalId.title: Externalid
ExternalId.description: External ID to use when assuming the role.

row_count.title: Row Count
row_count.description: The parameter name for row count in glue table.

column_count.title: Column Count
column_count.description: The parameter name for column count in glue table.

unique_count.title: Unique Count
unique_count.description: The parameter name for the count of unique value in a column.

unique_proportion.title: Unique Proportion
unique_proportion.description: The parameter name for the proportion of unique values in a column.

null_count.title: Null Count
null_count.description: The parameter name for the count of null values in a column.

null_proportion.title: Null Proportion
null_proportion.description: The parameter name for the proportion of null values in a column.

min.title: Min
min.description: The parameter name for the min value of a column.

max.title: Max
max.description: The parameter name for the max value of a column.

mean.title: Mean
mean.description: The parameter name for the mean value of a column.

median.title: Median
median.description: The parameter name for the median value of a column.

stdev.title: Stdev
stdev.description: The parameter name for the standard deviation of a column.

partition_patterns.title: Partition Patterns
partition_patterns.description: Regex patterns for filtering partitions for profile. The pattern should be a string like: "{'key':'value'}".

aws_profile.description: Named AWS profile to use. Only used if access key / secret are unset. If not set the default will be used

use_s3_bucket_tags.description: Whether or not to create tags in datahub from the s3 bucket

use_s3_object_tags.description: # Whether or not to create tags in datahub from the s3 object

exclude.title: Exclude
exclude.description: list of paths in glob pattern which will be excluded while scanning for the datasets

file_types.description: Files with extenstions specified here (subset of default value) only will be scanned to create dataset. Other files will be omitted.

default_extension.description: For files without extension it will assume the specified file type. If it is not set the files without extensions will be skipped.

enable_compression.description: Enable or disable processing compressed files. Currently .gz and .bz files are supported.

sample_files.description: Not listing all the files but only taking a handful amount of sample file to infer the schema. File count and file size calculation will be disabled. This can affect performance significantly if enabled

S3LineageProviderConfig.description: Any source that produces s3 lineage from/to Datasets should inherit this class.

include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

query_log_delay.title: Query Log Delay
query_log_delay.description: To account for the possibility that the query event arrives after the read event in the audit logs, we wait for at least query_log_delay additional events to be processed before attempting to resolve BigQuery job information from the logs. If query_log_delay is None, it gets treated as an unlimited delay, which prioritizes correctness at the expense of memory usage.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

KafkaConsumerConnectionConfig.title: KafkaConsumerConnectionConfig
KafkaConsumerConnectionConfig.description: Configuration class for holding connectivity information for Kafka consumers

schema_registry_config.title: Schema Registry Config
schema_registry_config.description: Extra schema registry config serialized as JSON. These options will be passed into Kafka's SchemaRegistryClient. https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/clients/confluent-kafka-python/html/index.html?#schemaregistryclient

consumer_config.title: Consumer Config
consumer_config.description: Extra consumer config serialized as JSON. These options will be passed into Kafka's DeserializingConsumer. See https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/clients/confluent-kafka-python/html/index.html#deserializingconsumer and https://github.com/edenhill/librdkafka/blob/master/CONFIGURATION.md .

profile_table_level_only.title: Profile Table Level Only
profile_table_level_only.description: Whether to perform profiling at table-level only or include column-level profiling as well.

max_number_of_fields_to_profile.title: Max Number Of Fields To Profile
max_number_of_fields_to_profile.description: A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of columns to profile for any table. `None` implies all columns. The cost of profiling goes up significantly as the number of columns to profile goes up.

include_field_null_count.title: Include Field Null Count
include_field_null_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of nulls for each column.

include_field_min_value.title: Include Field Min Value
include_field_min_value.description: Whether to profile for the min value of numeric columns.

include_field_max_value.title: Include Field Max Value
include_field_max_value.description: Whether to profile for the max value of numeric columns.

include_field_mean_value.title: Include Field Mean Value
include_field_mean_value.description: Whether to profile for the mean value of numeric columns.

include_field_median_value.title: Include Field Median Value
include_field_median_value.description: Whether to profile for the median value of numeric columns.

include_field_stddev_value.title: Include Field Stddev Value
include_field_stddev_value.description: Whether to profile for the standard deviation of numeric columns.

include_field_quantiles.title: Include Field Quantiles
include_field_quantiles.description: Whether to profile for the quantiles of numeric columns.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.title: Include Field Distinct Value Frequencies
include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

include_field_histogram.title: Include Field Histogram
include_field_histogram.description: Whether to profile for the histogram for numeric fields.

include_field_sample_values.title: Include Field Sample Values
include_field_sample_values.description: Whether to profile for the sample values for all columns.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether profiling should be done. Supports only table-level profiling at this stage

retry_backoff_multiplier.title: Retry Backoff Multiplier
retry_backoff_multiplier.description: Multiplier for exponential backoff when waiting to retry

max_retry_interval.title: Max Retry Interval
max_retry_interval.description: Maximum interval to wait when retrying

max_attempts.title: Max Attempts
max_attempts.description: Maximum number of attempts to retry before failing

platform_override_map.title: Platform Override Map
platform_override_map.description: A holder for platform -> platform mappings to generate correct dataset urns

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Identity provider for oauth, e.g- microsoft

client_id.title: Client Id
client_id.description: client id of your registered application

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: scopes required to connect to snowflake

use_certificate.title: Use Certificate
use_certificate.description: Do you want to use certificate and private key to authenticate using oauth

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: client secret of the application if use_certificate = false

authority_url.title: Authority Url
authority_url.description: Authority url of your identity provider

encoded_oauth_public_key.title: Encoded Oauth Public Key
encoded_oauth_public_key.description: base64 encoded certificate content if use_certificate = true

encoded_oauth_private_key.title: Encoded Oauth Private Key
encoded_oauth_private_key.description: base64 encoded private key content if use_certificate = true

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether provisioning of Snowflake role (used for ingestion) is enabled or not.

dry_run.title: Dry Run
dry_run.description: If provision_role is enabled, whether to dry run the sql commands for system admins to see what sql grant commands would be run without actually running the grant commands.

drop_role_if_exists.title: Drop Role If Exists
drop_role_if_exists.description: Useful during testing to ensure you have a clean slate role. Not recommended for production use cases.

run_ingestion.title: Run Ingestion
run_ingestion.description: If system admins wish to skip actual ingestion of metadata during testing of the provisioning of role.

admin_role.title: Admin Role
admin_role.description: The Snowflake role of admin user used for provisioning of the role specified by role config. System admins can audit the open source code and decide to use a different role.

admin_username.title: Admin Username
admin_username.description: The username to be used for provisioning of role.

admin_password.title: Admin Password
admin_password.description: The password to be used for provisioning of role.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the classifier to use. For DataHub,  use `datahub`

config.title: Config
config.description: The configuration required for initializing the classifier. If not specified, uses defaults for classifer type.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether classification should be used to auto-detect glossary terms

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for classification. This is used in combination with other patterns in parent config. Specify regex to match the entire table name in `database.schema.table` format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

column_pattern.title: Column Pattern
column_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter columns for classification. This is used in combination with other patterns in parent config. Specify regex to match the column name in `database.schema.table.column` format.

info_type_to_term.title: Info Type To Term
info_type_to_term.description: Optional mapping to provide glossary term identifier for info type

classifiers.title: Classifiers
classifiers.description: Classifiers to use to auto-detect glossary terms. If more than one classifier, infotype predictions from the classifier defined later in sequence take precedance.
